comments:
Try to profile several times StartStop for Memory/Execution with all options enabled (set boundary class depth to 10 and add a ALL filter where you have one entry * * * INCLUDED). Do a lot of switching between the profiling views and agents and watch error log.

Althogh the trace data is not very large some views react pretty slow (even on a T60p - CoreDuo at 2.16GHz with 2GB of RAM) especially "Method Level Information"  (when default filter is on).

Here are some exception that I found in the error log and their corresponding efect (in some cases).

"Average Base Time" column is empty in "Method Invocation" pane

----------
Ruslan, Pls take a look at the defect.

1. slow react
- it is reproduced in "Method Level Information" when clicking in tables with elements with large calls number (>1000). there is some internal logic which consumes cpu depending on calls number. so this issue is more related to the optimization task. I think it can be put to separate bug.

2. org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access
- not reproduced using latest builds on clean workspaces

3. Unable to find view with id:
org.eclipse.tptp.trace.jvmti.internal.client.views.CallStackViewer
- not reproduced using latest builds on clean workspaces

4. "Average Base Time" column is empty in "Method Invocation" pane
- I will attached proposed patch here

Created an attachment (id=62395)
Simple fix for empty columns

patch for project cvsroot/tptp/trace/org.eclipse.hyades.trace.views

I added missing for TRCFullMethodInvocation object type for displaying cu time

I think Eugene is right person to review the patch and apply it in org.eclipse.hyades.trace.views. Is it OK?

This defect is not a blocker for i2. 
Eugene pls check in the fix as soon as i3 stream is opened.

I cannot reproduce the problem as reported. However I reviewed the patch and looked at the exception been logged, this is safe to be checked in and also will fix the problem it intends to fix.
